item.title: H&M Current Trading Looks Pressured
item.description: H&M’s third-quarter profit delivery was a slight beat but the more critical current trading highlighted a challenged start to the fourth quarter, as evidenced by the 10% fall in local currency sales expected for September, Jefferies said.

item.title: Metals Waver on Lingering Demand Worries
item.description: Base metals and gold struggled for momentum as worries over demand and higher inflation kept prices capped.

item.title: Bank of Thailand Raises Policy Rate as Govt Gears Up for Stimulus
item.description: Thailand’s central bank raised its policy rate to the highest in nearly a decade in a bid to mitigate the risks of stronger inflation due to stimulus plans and the baht’s recent weakening.

item.title: Iraq Wedding Fire Kills More Than 100 People
item.description: At least 100 people died after a fire erupted during a wedding in Iraq’s northern Nineveh Province late Tuesday. Authorities said preliminary reports indicate fireworks used during the ceremony could be the cause.

item.title: Oil Rises on Shortage Concerns
item.description: Oil prices were rising, as worries over supply, stemming from Saudi-led production cuts, provided support to energy markets.

item.title: H&M Earnings Beat Forecasts
item.description: H&M posted earnings of SEK3.3 billion in the third quarter, with inventory efficiencies boosting cash flow, and said its goal of an operating margin of 10% during 2024 remained.

item.title: US Government Shutdown Fears Fuel Dollar Strength
item.description: The dollar extended gains, hitting another ten-month high against a basket of currencies, helped as investor worries over a potential government shutdown lifted safe-haven assets, Swissquote Bank said.

item.title: German Consumer Confidence Seen Worse Than Expected
item.description: Germany’s forward-looking consumer-sentiment index forecast confidence to fall to minus 26.5 in October, weakening for the second consecutive month, as persistently high inflation continues to hit sentiment.

item.title: Italian Government Bonds Underperform Ahead of New Macro Forecasts
item.description: Italian government bonds underperformed their eurozone peers ahead of the expected presentation by the government of the new macroeconomic and fiscal forecasts, with an expected upward revision to the budget deficit for this year and next, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Old Mutual Core Earnings Rise, Meet Guidance
item.description: Old Mutual reported higher first-half core earnings as sales grew 14%, but said customer income remained under pressure leading to outflows in personal savings and investments.

item.title: Chinese Central Bank Vows to Step Up Policy Support
item.description: The People’s Bank of China said it would step up policy support for the Chinese economy, which it said faces severe external challenges and weakening domestic demand.

item.title: China Has Second Thoughts About Controlling Prices in Its Massive Housing Market
item.description: China is starting to loosen pricing rules in its housing market—with unpredictable consequences.

item.title: Japan Can Keep Importing Russian Oil Above Price Cap
item.description: Japan said it has won authorization from the U.S. to continue importing Russian crude oil at a price above the $60-a-barrel cap observed by other U.S. allies.

item.title: How Elon Musk Came to Influence Fates of Nations
item.description: Musk’s control of key technologies has made him an independent actor on the global stage—except in China.

item.title: The Fall of What Was India's Most Valuable Startup
item.description: Once a $22 billion ed-tech giant, Byju’s is now dealing with lawsuits and questions over its financial management.

item.title: The War in Ukraine Is Also a Giant Arms Fair
item.description: Arms makers are getting orders and drawing interest for weapons deployed in Ukraine, where their performance could help shape military procurement for years to come.

item.title: Libya Floods Wiped Out Entire Family Trees
item.description: Clans in the port city of Derna that can trace their bloodlines back centuries lost scores of relatives in the catastrophe.

item.title: Rising Loan Costs Are Hurting Riskier Companies
item.description: Investors fear unsustainably high interest rates will spark bank-loan defaults.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase paid $75 million to settle a lawsuit alleging that the bank aided Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking.
item.description: JPMorgan Chase paid $75 million to settle a lawsuit alleging that the bank aided Jeffrey Epstein’s sex trafficking.

item.title: Stocks fell sharply Tuesday. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow dropped 1.5%, 1.6% and 1.1%, respectively.
item.description: Stocks fell sharply Tuesday. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow dropped 1.5%, 1.6% and 1.1%, respectively.
